neighbors.name: Abram P. Dye & Carrie N. Dye
neighbors.claims: Abram P. Dye and Carrie N. Dye are listed as owners of a rural parcel in Saline County, Kansas (parcel ID 085128270000000700001) [Saline County Parcel Search](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/Appraiser/parcelsearch). Local records indicate long-term residency in Salina, with family ties noted in local obituaries [Salina Journal Obituary](https://www.tributearchive.com/obituaries/20245282/Carol-Marie-Corey/wall). A search of the Saline County Planning Commission minutes from key renewable energy hearings (August 2023) shows no record of their attendance or public comment regarding development projects [Planning Commission Minutes](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338). There is no record of either holding a public office or leadership position in the county [Saline County Commission](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/Government/County).
neighbors.influence_justification: No public role; private landowners

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted local farmer or community member start a personal conversation, emphasizing respect for their farmland and assuring that any project impact on their land and roads will be minimized.

citations.claim: Abram P. Dye and Carrie N. Dye are listed as owners of a rural parcel in Saline County, Kansas
citations.title: Saline County Parcel Search

citations.claim: Local records indicate long-term residency in Salina, with family ties noted in local obituaries
citations.title: Obituary for Carol Marie Corey - Tribute Archive

citations.claim: A search of the Saline County Planning Commission minutes from key renewable energy hearings (August 2023) shows no record of their attendance or public comment
citations.title: Saline County Planning Commission Meeting Minutes August 22, 2023

citations.claim: There is no record of either holding a public office or leadership position in the county
citations.title: Saline County Government Commission

neighbors.name: Judith L. Sapegin
neighbors.claims: Judith L. Sapegin is the recorded owner of a Saline County parcel in a rural area (ID 085128280000000700001), identified in right-of-way surveys for local infrastructure projects [KDOT ROW Survey](https://ikewebstorage.blob.core.windows.net/files/004-085_ka323002-ROW2-p1.pdf). She was not listed as an attendee or speaker in the August 2023 Saline County Planning Commission hearings regarding battery storage conditional use permits [Planning Commission Minutes](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338). No public comments from Sapegin about local development or clean energy issues have been found in local news sources [Salina Post](https://salinapost.com). She does not appear to serve in any local government capacity [Saline County Commission](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/Government/County).
neighbors.influence_justification: No public profile or roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her one-on-one in a respectful manner, highlighting how the plan will protect her land and family legacy, and clarify long-term safeguards for her property.

neighbors.name: Sabrina T.S. Ozisik & Hakan Ozisik
neighbors.claims: Hakan Ozisik and Sabrina T.S. Ozisik jointly own a tract of land in rural Saline County (parcel ID 085128280000000600001), confirmed by state project maps which locate their property near McReynolds Road [KDOT Project Maps](https://ikewebstorage.blob.core.windows.net/files/projects/KA-3230-02/004-085-KA-3230-02_Public-Meeting-Project-Maps.pdf). Sabrina Ozisik is documented as being in attendance at the Saline County Planning Commission meeting on August 22, 2023, during the hearing for the 'Mountain Peak Energy Storage' Conditional Use Permit (CUP 23-103) [Planning Commission Minutes](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338). While she attended this critical development meeting, the minutes do not record her making a verbal public comment or statement [Planning Commission Minutes](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338). They are not known to hold any local public office [Saline County Commission](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/Government/County).
neighbors.influence_justification: Attends planning meetings; engaged

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in a neighborly way focused on how noise, traffic, and views will be managed. Acknowledge the need for transparency regarding project specifics, as they have previously attended planning meetings regarding energy storage.

citations.claim: Hakan Ozisik and Sabrina T.S. Ozisik jointly own a tract of land in rural Saline County confirmed by state project maps
citations.title: KDOT K-4 Preliminary Design Public Meeting Project Maps

neighbors.name: Michael A & Dawn A Radford Revocable Inter Vivos Trust
neighbors.claims: Michael A. Radford and Dawn A. Radford hold their Saline County land under a revocable living trust, as reflected in county property records ([Whitepages](https://www.whitepages.com/name/Michael-Radford/KS)). No public statements, meeting minutes, or media reports were found of the Radfords taking a position on local development or clean energy projects, including the recent battery storage hearings ([Salina Post](https://salinapost.com/posts/e74744c0-255e-453b-83b9-51557137da81)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private landowners; no public office found

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through a personal, respectful conversation via a trusted community member, emphasizing listening to any of their farmland or property concerns.

neighbors.name: Randall C McGraw & Lindsay R McGraw
neighbors.claims: Randall C. McGraw and Lindsay R. McGraw jointly own a rural parcel in Saline County, Kansas ([Whitepages](https://www.whitepages.com/name/Randall-McGraw/KS)). Lindsay R. McGraw is a 2023 graduate of the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences, indicating a background in health professions ([UAMS News](https://news.uams.edu/2023/05/22/uams-graduates-1096-health-care-professionals/)). There is no record in local news or public minutes of the McGraws speaking for or against development or renewable energy proposals in the area ([Salina Journal](https://www.salina.com/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: No known civic roles; private citizens

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the McGraws informally via a neighbor or agricultural extension contact they trust, focusing on transparent information-sharing and addressing any questions about land impact.

neighbors.name: Eric M Puvogel & Amanda L Meier
neighbors.claims: Eric M. Puvogel and Amanda L. Meier (also known as Amanda Puvogel) are landowners in Saline County who experienced the loss of their historic home on East Cloud Street due to a fire in November 2020 ([KSAL News](https://www.ksal.com/eastern-saline-county-home-destroyed-by-fire/)). Amanda Puvogel serves as a Health Educator for the Saline County Health Department ([Saline County](https://salinecountyks.gov/staff-directory/Health-Department)). While they have not made known public comments on renewable energy projects, their experience with property loss may make them sensitive to safety concerns, a topic raised by others in recent battery storage hearings ([Salina 311](https://www.salina311.com/stories/2026-01-06-commission-overturns-planning-boards-unanimous-approval-of-battery-storage-project/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Amanda Puvogel is a Saline County Health Dept employee

approach_recommendations.engage: A friendly, face-to-face approach via a mutual acquaintance or local community meeting can help open dialogue. Be prepared to discuss safety and emergency response plans in detail given their past property loss.

citations.claim: Eric M. Puvogel and Amanda L. Meier experienced the loss of their historic home on East Cloud Street due to a fire in November 2020
citations.title: Eastern Saline County Home Destroyed by Fire

citations.claim: Amanda Puvogel serves as a Health Educator for the Saline County Health Department
citations.title: Saline County Health Department Staff Directory

citations.claim: safety concerns were raised by others in recent battery storage hearings
citations.title: Commission Overturns Planning Board's Approval of Battery Project

neighbors.name: Wade & Tiffany Waddle
neighbors.claims: The Waddle family name has deep roots in Saline County farming, with records of Samuel H. Waddle settling in the area in 1866 ([KSGenWeb](https://www.ksgenweb.org/archives/1918ks/biow/waddlesh.html)). Wade Waddle serves as the Assistant Chief for Saline County Rural Fire District No. 1, where he actively secures grant funding for emergency equipment ([Citizen Portal](https://citizenportal.ai/articles/6536169/Kansas/Saline-County/Rural-Fire-District-No-1-authorized-to-accept-35000-in-foundation-grants-for-wildland-UTV)). In August 2023, Wade Waddle spoke at a Saline County Planning and Zoning Commission meeting regarding a proposed battery storage project near his residence on McReynolds Road ([Saline County](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338)). He expressed specific concerns regarding the local fire district's resources and capability to handle emergencies at the proposed facility ([Saline County](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Assistant Fire Chief, Rural Fire District No. 1

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage directly regarding safety protocols. As a fire chief, his primary concern is emergency response capabilities. Demonstrate how the project will support, not strain, local fire districts (e.g., training, equipment donations) and address his specific testimony regarding resource shortages.

citations.title: Biography of Samuel H. Waddle

citations.title: Rural Fire District No. 1 authorized to accept grants

citations.claim: Expressed concerns regarding local fire district capabilities

neighbors.name: Justin D. Jensen
neighbors.claims: Justin D. Jensen is a resident of Gypsum, KS, and a recipient of USDA agricultural subsidies ([EWG](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=20169&progcode=tot_cfap2&page=2&yr=2023)). He is the son of the late Michael Ray Jensen, a lifelong farmer and rancher in the area ([Ryan Mortuary](https://www.ryanmortuary.com/obituary/Michael-Jensen)). Justin attended the August 22, 2023, Saline County Planning and Zoning Commission meeting regarding a Conditional Use Permit for development but did not provide public testimony ([Saline County](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338)). His family's land history includes a 2004 property valuation dispute involving Richard R. and Sandra L. Jensen ([FindLaw](https://caselaw.findlaw.com/ks-court-of-appeals/1418887.html)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Active in local agriculture; attended zoning hearing

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with technical agricultural data. Given his attendance at previous zoning hearings and receipt of ag subsidies, focus on the economic stability the project offers to farming operations and the preservation of family land assets.

neighbors.name: Ronald A. & Sandra K. Kinkelaar
neighbors.claims: Ronald A. and Sandra K. Kinkelaar are landowners in Saline County with property interests impacted by local infrastructure projects, such as the K-4 Highway improvements ([KDOT](https://ikewebstorage.blob.core.windows.net/files/projects/KA-3230-02/004-085-KA-3230-02_Public-Meeting-Project-Maps.pdf)). They attended the Saline County Planning and Zoning Commission meeting on August 22, 2023, concerning solar and battery storage permits, though they did not speak during the public comment period ([Saline County](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local landowners; attended zoning meeting

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out via a mutual contact or standard mailer. Acknowledge their long-term presence and interest in local infrastructure (evidenced by K-4 and zoning meeting attendance). Focus on low-impact design and property rights.

neighbors.name: Steven G Dunning & Cynthia D Dunning
neighbors.claims: Steven G. Dunning and Cynthia D. Dunning are associated with a property on Holmes Road in Assaria, Kansas, which is situated in the vicinity of a proposed solar project described as being east of South Holmes Road [Salina Post](https://salinapost.com/posts/e74744c0-255e-453b-83b9-51557137da81) [Men Stopping Violence](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/cynthia-dunning/). Steven Dunning serves as the President of Salina Planing Mill, Inc., a role he has held for over 14 years, and is involved in the Architectural Woodwork Institute [Miller Wood Trade Pub](https://millerwoodtradepub.com/whos-who-march-2024/) [AWI](https://awinet.org/about-awi/chapters/). He has also made local political contributions using a Salina business address [Kansas Ethics](http://ethics.ks.gov/CFAScanned/StWide/2018ElecCycle/201801/SW01MH_201801.pdf). As of early 2026, neither individual has been noted making public statements regarding renewable development in county meeting minutes.
neighbors.influence_justification: Local business president; industry chapter leader

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Steven with a professional tone, acknowledging his leadership at Salina Planing Mill. Focus discussion on the Holmes Road property's proximity to the project, emphasizing property value protection and fair contracting terms suitable for a business-minded landowner.

neighbors.name: Ellen Kay Ward
neighbors.claims: Ellen Kay Ward is an absentee landowner residing in Tahlequah, Oklahoma, who receives agricultural subsidies for property in Saline County, Kansas [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=20169&progcode=total_dis&page=4&yr=2024). She is the daughter of the late Kurtiss Forsberg, a distinguished local dairy farmer in the Mentor area, indicating the property is likely a family legacy asset [Crick-Christians Funeral Home](https://www.crick-christiansfuneralhome.com/obituaries/Kurtiss-Forsberg?obId=30920719). She has not spoken publicly about the project in local hearings, likely due to her out-of-state residency.
neighbors.influence_justification: Absentee landowner; daughter of local dairy farmer

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact via mail in Tahlequah, OK. Reference her father's (Kurtiss Forsberg) agricultural legacy in the Mentor area to build trust. Position the project as a way to retain family land ownership through passive income while preserving the farm's history.

citations.claim: Resides in Tahlequah, Oklahoma and receives agricultural subsidies

neighbors.name: Dye Elan Revocable Trust
neighbors.claims: The Dye Elan Revocable Trust is a landowner in Saline County, listed on the notification radius for the Mountain Peak Energy Storage project ([Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf)). The trust is associated with Elan Dye, the surviving spouse of local bagpiper Bobbie Leroy Dye (d. 2020), and is based at a residence on South Simpson Road, located less than one mile north of the proposed battery storage site ([Carlson Funeral Home](https://www.carlsonfh.net/obituaries/bobbie-leroy-dye)). Elan Dye has been listed as a member of the local Lions Club district ([Lions Club](https://cdn2.webdamdb.com/md_gS8dWKAQ63F02c0l.jpg.pdf?v=1)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Widow of a local resident; no record of public office or significant political contributions found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Elan Dye directly at the South Simpson Road residence. Given the close proximity to the proposed project site (approx. 0.8 miles), prioritize discussions regarding visual screening and construction traffic management.

neighbors.name: Fulton Ruby A Trust
neighbors.claims: The Fulton Ruby A Trust is a landowning entity in Saline County designated as a recipient of federal agricultural subsidies ([EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://www.starvingfarmer.com/county/169/20)). Public records regarding the Mountain Peak Energy Storage project identify the primary contact for the trust as Gerald Fulton, with a mailing address in Goddard, Kansas ([Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf)). A Gerald Fulton in Goddard is associated with an engineering background, though specific involvement in Saline County development hearings was not found ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/f/gerald-fulton/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: absentee owner/trustee located in Sedgwick County (Goddard); no evidence of local political activity or testimony in Saline County hearings.

approach_recommendations.engage: Direct correspondence to Gerald Fulton in Goddard, KS. As an absentee trustee, focus on lease income potential and lack of interference with existing agricultural operations.

neighbors.name: Cossette Jerrold E Jr Tr & Cossette J E Sr
neighbors.claims: Dr. Jerrold E. Cossette Jr. is a long-standing Otolaryngologist and Plastic Surgeon in Salina, practicing for over 50 years and affiliated with Salina Regional Health Center ([Healthgrades](https://www.healthgrades.com/physician/dr-jerrold-cossette-32wbp)). He is a significant landowner in the county, listed as a top recipient of Livestock Forage Disaster Program subsidies in 2022 ([EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=20169&progcode=tot_lvstfo&yr=2022&regionname=SalineCounty,Kansas)). Dr. Cossette has a history of engaging in complex business tax litigation regarding aircraft usage for his medical practice ([FindLaw](https://caselaw.findlaw.com/ks-supreme-court/1045807.html)) and is a documented donor to the Kansas Medical Society Political Action Committee ([Kansas Ethics Commission](https://www.kansas.gov/ethics/CFAScanned/PACs/2014ElecCycle/201407/PAC115_201407.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Prominent medical professional with significant land holdings and business sophistication; documented donor to political committees.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Dr. Jerrold Cossette directly. He is a sophisticated stakeholder with medical, aviation, and agricultural business interests. Frame discussions around technical competence, long-term land value, and minimal disruption to his livestock operations.

citations.claim: Practicing for over 50 years and affiliated with Salina Regional Health Center

neighbors.name: Richard L. Kelley, Ruth A. Kelley, Zachary J. Kelley
neighbors.claims: Richard L. Kelley has served in the Kansas National Guard, based in Salina [Department of Defense](https://media.defense.gov/2017/Nov/02/2002670552/-1/-1/1/171102-N-ZZ320-0698.pdf). The Kelley family was identified in the draft as landowners opposing the Plus Power battery storage facility; however, their specific participation in the protest petition could not be verified in available public records, though a valid petition signed by 80 parcel owners did cause the project's denial in January 2026 [Salina311](https://www.salina311.com/stories/2026-01-06-commission-overturns-planning-boards-unanimous-approval-of-battery-storage-project/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Military service record; no other public roles found

approach_recommendations.engage: Establish initial contact to verify their position on the project, as public records do not explicitly link them to the protest petition. Acknowledge the general community sentiment regarding the recent denial while seeking to understand their specific concerns.

citations.claim: Richard L. Kelley has served in the Kansas National Guard, based in Salina
citations.title: Kansas National Guard Plains Guardian

citations.claim: a valid petition signed by 80 parcel owners did cause the project's denial in January 2026
citations.title: Commission Overturns Planning Board's Unanimous Approval of Battery Storage Project

neighbors.name: Bebe Davis Tucker
neighbors.claims: Bebe Davis Tucker is a listed property owner within the notification radius of the Mountain Peak Energy Storage (Plus Power) project at McReynolds and Simpson Road [Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf). She maintains a mailing address in Dallas, Texas, indicating she may be an absentee landowner [Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf). The proposed battery facility was denied by the County Commission on January 6, 2026, following a valid protest petition signed by over 31% of the notification area's landowners, a group that includes Tucker [Salina311](https://www.salina311.com/stories/2026-01-06-commission-overturns-planning-boards-unanimous-approval-of-battery-storage-project/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Absentee landowner (Texas address); listed in notification radius

approach_recommendations.engage: Due to her Dallas residency, outreach should be conducted via mail or through a local property manager if one exists. Emphasize how the project design minimizes impact on property values and rural character, addressing the specific concerns raised by the protest petition group.

citations.claim: Bebe Davis Tucker is a listed property owner within the notification radius of the Mountain Peak Energy Storage (Plus Power) project at McReynolds and Simpson Road
citations.title: Mountain Peak Energy Storage CUP Application - Appendix L through R

citations.claim: She maintains a mailing address in Dallas, Texas, indicating she may be an absentee landowner
citations.title: Mountain Peak Energy Storage CUP Application - Appendix L through R

citations.claim: The proposed battery facility was denied by the County Commission on January 6, 2026, following a valid protest petition signed by over 31% of the notification area's landowners
citations.title: Commission Overturns Planning Board's Unanimous Approval of Battery Storage Project

neighbors.name: Rodney A. Bradshaw
neighbors.claims: Rodney A. Bradshaw is a resident of Salina, KS, residing on Crestview Dr [NPD](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/b/rodney-bradshaw/). While the draft identified him as an opponent of the Plus Power project, the project site is located in a rural area at McReynolds and Simpson Road, and Bradshaw's specific property interest in that area or signature on the protest petition could not be verified in public records [Salina311](https://www.salina311.com/stories/2026-01-06-commission-overturns-planning-boards-unanimous-approval-of-battery-storage-project/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Resident of Salina; no rural land ties confirmed

approach_recommendations.engage: Verify if Bradshaw owns rural land near the project site, as his primary residence appears to be within the City of Salina. If he is a landowner, focus on clarification of safety protocols, as safety was a primary driver for the recent project denial.

neighbors.name: Harbin Farm Enterprises Llc
neighbors.claims: Harbin Farm Enterprises LLC is a Kansas entity managed by Dr. Gary Harbin, a prominent local orthopedic surgeon [Salina Ortho](https://www.salinaortho.com/harbin.html). Unlike a passive holding company, this entity is actively engaged in industrial land use; in 2023-2024, it filed applications to allow American Sand and Gravel, LLC to extend mining operations onto 175 acres of its property [Saline County Planning](https://salina-tv.com/cablecastapi/shows/25950/publicfiles/4). The entity also holds water rights for irrigation and industrial use (sand and gravel) [Kansas Dept of Agriculture](https://sftp.kda.ks.gov:4443/Notices/Stockton_Field_Office/2024/49991.20240409.Apv.Chg.pdf). Dr. Harbin is a documented donor to The Land Institute, a sustainable agriculture research organization, suggesting an interest in land conservation or perennial agriculture alongside industrial leasing [The Land Institute](https://landinstitute.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Land-Report-095.pdf).
neighbors.influence_justification: Principal is a prominent local physician (50+ years experience) and the entity controls significant land with active industrial/mining leases.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Dr. Gary Harbin directly. Acknowledge his dual interests in sustainable agriculture (Land Institute donation) and industrial land utilization (sand mining). Position the project as compatible with both revenue goals and land preservation.

neighbors.profile_summary: Entity managed by Dr. Gary Harbin; combines agricultural holdings with active sand/gravel mining leases.

citations.claim: Managed by Dr. Gary Harbin, a prominent local orthopedic surgeon
citations.title: Gary L. Harbin, M.D. - Salina Ortho

citations.claim: Filed applications to allow American Sand and Gravel, LLC to extend mining operations onto 175 acres
citations.title: Saline County Planning & Zoning Commission Agenda Aug 2023

citations.claim: Holds water rights for irrigation and industrial use (sand and gravel)
citations.title: Application for Approval to Change Point of Diversion

citations.claim: Documented donor to The Land Institute
citations.title: The Land Institute Land Report 95

neighbors.name: Tillberg Arnold E Tr
neighbors.claims: The Tillberg Arnold E Trust appears to be a passive land-holding entity. The namesake, Arnold E. Tillberg, was active in the region as early as the 1960s (attending Kansas State University) and 1980s (Arnold E. Tillberg, Inc.), suggesting a long-standing family presence [Kansas State University Yearbook](https://archive.org/stream/royalpurple1960unse/royalpurple1960unse_djvu.txt). A related entity, 'Tillberg Land, LLC,' was forfeited by the Kansas Secretary of State in 2020 and 2022, indicating potential inactivity or consolidation of business structures [Kansas Secretary of State](https://sos.ks.gov/publications/Register/Volume-41/PDF/Vol-41-No-34-August-25-2022-July-2022-Forfeitures.pdf). The Trust was identified as a property owner within the notification radius of the Mountain Peak Energy Storage (battery) project in 2023-2025, placing it geographically near recent renewable development controversies [Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf).
neighbors.influence_justification: No active political or business leadership found; related LLCs are forfeited.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as a legacy landowner. Verify current trustee contact information, as corporate filings for related entities are not in good standing.

neighbors.profile_summary: Legacy family trust with history in the region; related corporate entities are inactive.

neighbors.name: Bradshaw Business Properties Llc
neighbors.claims: Bradshaw Business Properties LLC is a land-holding entity associated with Rodney A. Bradshaw, a Salina resident [Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf). The entity's corporate status was forfeited in Kansas as of July 2021, suggesting the LLC may be defunct or administratively neglected despite continuing to hold property title [Kansas Secretary of State](https://sos.ks.gov/publications/Register/Volume-40/PDF/Vol_40_No_34_August_26_2021_July_2021_Forfeitures.pdf). The LLC was listed as a notified neighbor for the Mountain Peak Energy Storage project in 2023-2025, indicating the property is located in an area recently subject to intense zoning debates regarding battery storage [Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf).
neighbors.influence_justification: Entity is forfeited/inactive; limited to property ownership.

approach_recommendations.engage: Direct outreach to Rodney A. Bradshaw in Salina. Note that the LLC is currently forfeited, which may complicate lease signing; this could be a leverage point to offer legal/admin assistance as part of a land deal.

neighbors.profile_summary: Inactive/forfeited LLC holding land near contested battery storage site; controlled by Rodney Bradshaw.

citations.claim: Associated with Rodney A. Bradshaw, a Salina resident
citations.title: Mountain Peak Energy Storage Conditional Use Permit Application Appendix

citations.claim: Entity's corporate status was forfeited in Kansas as of July 2021
citations.title: Kansas Register Vol 40 No 34 Forfeitures

neighbors.name: S&S Hammond LLC
neighbors.claims: S&S Hammond LLC is a Kansas domestic limited liability company identified as the property owner for the proposed Mountain Peak Energy Storage project ([Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Application%20Mountain%20Peak%20Energy.pdf)). The entity owns the subject parcel at the southwest corner of McReynolds Road and Simpson Road (Section 28, Township 15, Range 2), where the battery energy storage system was proposed ([Salina Post](https://salinapost.com/posts/924cb67c-261d-4a54-b8af-210ca14b95c6)). Public land records indicate the entity acquired title to specific parcels in 2021 from the Mary A. Hammond Trust, with Stacey Hammond and Shelly Hammond serving as trustees/signatories for the transaction ([Saline County Deeds](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20U%20&%20V%20Notice%20and%20Deed.pdf)). The LLC's registered address is located in Topeka, KS ([Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Application%20Mountain%20Peak%20Energy.pdf)). As the lessor and applicant co-signer for the Conditional Use Permit (CUP 25-09), the entity actively facilitated the development attempt ([Salina Media](https://salina-tv.com/cablecastapi/shows/26724/publicfiles/4)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owner of the project site; direct financial interest in the development lease; members are non-resident landowners.

approach_recommendations.engage: Maintain coordination regarding the lease status following the January 2026 permit denial. Ensure they are kept informed of any potential appeal processes or revised application strategies, as they are the primary site host.

citations.claim: Identified as the property owner for the proposed Mountain Peak Energy Storage project
citations.title: Conditional Use Permit Application - Mountain Peak Energy

citations.claim: Owns the subject parcel at the southwest corner of McReynolds Road and Simpson Road
citations.title: Saline County Commissioners deny battery storage facility

neighbors.name: Hammond Family LLC
neighbors.claims: Hammond Family LLC is a distinct legal entity from S&S Hammond LLC, appearing on the certified list of property owners within the notification radius of the project ([Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf)). Public notices regarding the Mountain Peak Energy Storage project were directed to this entity with an 'Attn: Robin Newton' designation ([Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf)). While the entity holds agricultural land in the vicinity, specific stance evidence (support letters or opposition testimony) was not explicitly attributed to this specific LLC in the available minutes, distinct from the broader neighborhood opposition ([Salina Post](https://salinapost.com/posts/924cb67c-261d-4a54-b8af-210ca14b95c6)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Listed as a notified neighbor; no evidence of active leadership or public testimony found in meeting records.

approach_recommendations.engage: Treat as a distinct entity from the S&S Hammond LLC (project host). Reach out to the listed contact (Robin Newton) to determine their specific position, as they may have been lumped into the general opposition during the hearings without providing specific testimony.

citations.claim: Appearing on the certified list of property owners within the notification radius
citations.title: Appendix L through R - Certified Property Owners List

citations.claim: Public notices... directed to this entity with an 'Attn: Robin Newton' designation
citations.title: Appendix L through R - Certified Property Owners List

citations.claim: Specific stance evidence... was not explicitly attributed to this specific LLC
citations.title: Saline County Commissioners deny battery storage facility

neighbors.name: Saline County
neighbors.claims: Saline County is the governing body responsible for zoning and land use regulation in the unincorporated areas surrounding the project. On January 6, 2026, the Saline County Commission voted 4-1 to deny the Conditional Use Permit (CUP 25-09) for the Mountain Peak Energy Storage project, overturning a previous unanimous approval by the Planning Commission ([Salina311](https://www.salina311.com/stories/2026-01-06-commission-overturns-planning-boards-unanimous-approval-of-battery-storage-project/)). The denial was triggered by a valid protest petition signed by owners of approximately 31% of the notification area ([Salina Post](https://salinapost.com/posts/924cb67c-261d-4a54-b8af-210ca14b95c6)). The Commission cited concerns regarding inconsistency with the character of the community and safety as reasons for the denial ([KSAL](https://www.ksal.com/4-1-vote-stops-power-storage-facility-project/)). Prior to this decision, the County had adopted regulations for Battery Energy Storage Systems (Resolution 25-24-23) in August 2025 ([Citizen Portal](https://citizenportal.ai/articles/6484905/Saline-County/Kansas/Saline-County-adopts-battery-energy-storage-system-regulations-after-months-of-review)) and commercial solar regulations in 2024 ([Saline County](https://salina311.com/county-commission-approves-new-solar-energy-system-provisions/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Ultimate regulatory authority; demonstrated willingness to overturn Planning Commission recommendations in the face of public opposition.

approach_recommendations.engage: Given the recent denial (Jan 2026), immediate re-engagement requires addressing the specific findings of 'inconsistency with community character' and safety concerns. Any future attempts must drastically improve community consensus to avoid another protest petition, which triggers the supermajority vote requirement.

citations.claim: Saline County Commission voted 4-1 to deny the Conditional Use Permit (CUP 25-09)
citations.title: Saline County Commission Overturns Planning Board's Unanimous Approval

citations.claim: Triggered by a valid protest petition signed by owners of approximately 31% of the notification area
citations.title: Saline County Commissioners deny battery storage facility

citations.claim: Cited concerns regarding inconsistency with the character of the community and safety
citations.title: 4-1 Vote Stops Power Storage Facility Project

citations.title: County Commission Approves New Solar Energy System Provisions

neighbors.name: Forsberg Farm Trust
neighbors.claims: The Forsberg Farm Trust is a private landholding entity with a mailing address in Clinton, Illinois, care of Roger E. Forsberg ([Saline County Planning Notice](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf)). The entity was explicitly listed as a notified property owner for the Mountain Peak Energy Storage (Plus Power) project, a battery energy storage system proposed near Assaria, Kansas ([Saline County Planning Notice](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf)). While the Trust itself did not submit public comments, related family member Doug Forsberg (residing at 2652 E Mentor Rd) testified at a Planning Commission meeting in August 2023 regarding the project, expressing concerns about road conditions, blind spots, and traffic safety on Mattison Road ([Planning Commission Minutes](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338)). Related family entities, such as 'Forsberg Bros,' have been recipients of USDA agricultural subsidies ([EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=20169&progcode=tot_dairy&regionname=SalineCounty,Kansas)).
neighbors.influence_justification: The Trust is an absentee owner (Illinois-based) and has not taken a public stance itself, though local family members are active in zoning hearings regarding infrastructure.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact Trustee Roger E. Forsberg in Illinois for formal permissions. Simultaneously, engage local family member Doug Forsberg regarding road use agreements (RUMA) and traffic management plans, as he has a documented history of concern regarding industrial traffic on local roads.

neighbors.profile_summary: Absentee farm trust based in Illinois (Roger E. Forsberg). The Trust was a notified neighbor for the Mountain Peak Battery Storage project. Local family member Doug Forsberg is vocal about road safety and infrastructure impacts from energy/industrial development.

citations.claim: Mailing address is Clinton, Illinois, care of Roger E. Forsberg; listed as notified owner for Mountain Peak Energy Storage
citations.title: Mountain Peak Energy Storage Conditional Use Permit Application - Appendix L-R

citations.claim: Doug Forsberg testified regarding road conditions and traffic safety at Planning Commission meeting
citations.title: Saline County Planning and Zoning Board Commission Meeting Minutes

citations.claim: Forsberg Bros recipient of USDA subsidies
citations.title: EWG Farm Subsidy Database - Saline County, KS

neighbors.name: Spare Bernard T & Debra E Living Tr
neighbors.claims: Landowner notified of the Mountain Peak Energy Storage (Battery) Conditional Use Permit application in 2025 ([source](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf)). Bernard T. Spare served as the elected Township Treasurer for St. John Township in Stafford County, Kansas ([source](https://www.staffordcounty.org/uploads/1/3/3/6/133660997/st_john_2024.pdf)). The entity is a recipient of USDA agricultural subsidies ([source](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?z=1&zip=67576&page=18)). Bernard and Debra Spare are listed as Water Use Correspondents for agricultural operations in Kansas ([source](https://sftp.kda.ks.gov:4443/Notices/Stafford_Field_Office/2025/11559.20250604.Apv.Chg.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Bernard Spare has held elected public office as Township Treasurer (Stafford County) and the family maintains long-standing agricultural water rights.

approach_recommendations.engage: Acknowledge Bernard Spare's public service experience and the family's agricultural history. Address land stewardship and potential impacts of the nearby battery storage project, as they were legally notified of the development.

neighbors.profile_summary: The Spare Living Trust represents a multigenerational farming family based in St. John, KS, with land interests in Saline County. Bernard T. Spare has served as an elected township official (Treasurer) and manages water rights for the family's agricultural operations. They were identified as notified parties for the Mountain Peak Energy Storage project.

citations.claim: Landowner notified of the Mountain Peak Energy Storage (Battery) Conditional Use Permit application in 2025
citations.title: Saline County Conditional Use Permit Application Appendix L-R

citations.title: St. John Township Financial Report 2024

neighbors.name: Myers Warren David & Vickie Diane Rev Trust
neighbors.claims: Landowner notified of the Mountain Peak Energy Storage (Battery) Conditional Use Permit application in 2025 ([source](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf)). Warren Myers formerly served as a School Board Member for Southeast of Saline Schools (USD 306) ([source](https://www.ksde.gov/Portals/0/School%20Finance/budget/Budget_at_a_Glance/07-08_Summary/ProfileInformation306.pdf)). Warren also worked as a bus driver and sponsor for district activities ([source](https://files-backend.assets.thrillshare.com/documents/asset/uploaded_file/2303/Usd306/1737f255-5c3c-4209-a2f0-251589002c80/April_2_.pdf?disposition=inline)). Vickie Myers has operated locally as a cake designer ([source](https://www.labrisaphotography.com/2015/02/16/lindsay-nolan-wedding-photography-salina-ks-chris-hsieh-emma-york/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Warren Myers is a former elected School Board Member for the local district (Southeast of Saline) and a long-time community volunteer.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Warren and Vickie Myers directly. Acknowledge Warren's past service on the School Board. Be prepared to discuss visual and property impacts, as they were notified of the nearby battery storage project.

neighbors.profile_summary: The Myers Revocable Trust is controlled by Warren and Vickie Myers, long-time residents of Assaria. Warren is a former Southeast of Saline School Board member and school employee. The family owns property near the proposed Mountain Peak Energy Storage facility and was included in the formal notification list for that project.

neighbors.name: J And M Trust
neighbors.claims: Likely associated with Jason and Matthew Myers, sons of Warren and Vickie Myers (N-02), who are listed as relatives in public records ([source](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/vickie-myers/)). Jason Myers was a student-athlete at Southeast of Saline High School in the late 1990s ([source](https://files-backend.assets.thrillshare.com/documents/asset/uploaded_file/2303/Usd306/38b8fa0d-5f21-4858-9290-c77419454576/April_4_.pdf?disposition=inline)). Matthew Myers is listed as a resident of Assaria, KS ([source](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/m/matthew-myers/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Beneficiaries appear to be the adult children of the Myers family (N-02). No independent community leadership roles found for this specific trust entity.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via Warren and Vickie Myers (N-02) to confirm the point of contact. The trust is likely a family estate planning vehicle for their sons, Jason and Matthew.

neighbors.profile_summary: The J And M Trust is likely a family trust established for Jason and Matthew Myers, the adult sons of neighbors Warren and Vickie Myers. The parcel PIN sequence suggests a subdivision or relation to the Myers Revocable Trust (N-02).

overview_summary: Of the 27 neighbors profiled, 17 are individuals and 10 are organizations, primarily consisting of multi-generational family farm trusts, agricultural LLCs, and the Saline County government. While 23 neighbors have an unknown stance, three have expressed opposition and one supports the development, with qualitative data suggesting concerns regarding farmland preservation and agricultural continuity. The group includes three high-influence and six medium-influence entities, including local government and established farming families whose interests will likely drive community sentiment and regulatory oversight.
